name: Ceaseless Searblades
text: Whenever you activate an ability of an Elemental, Ceaseless Searblades gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Flamekins' fires burn cool until they decide otherwise.

name: Celestial Ancient
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

editions.flavor:
"We thought the clouds had moved from the night sky. Then the night sky moved, and the horizon grew wings."
—Josuri

"We thought the clouds had moved from the night sky. Then the night sky moved, and the horizon grew wings."
—Josuri

"We thought the clouds had moved from the night sky. Then the night sky moved, and the horizon grew wings."
—Josuri
"We thought the clouds had moved from the night sky. Then the night sky moved, and the horizon grew wings."—Josuri

name: Celestial Archon
text:
Bestow {5}{W}{W} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Flying, first strike
Enchanted creature gets +4/+4 and has flying and first strike.

name: Celestial Colonnade
text:
Celestial Colonnade enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
{3}{W}{U}: Until end of turn, Celestial Colonnade becomes a 4/4 white and blue Elemental creature with flying and vigilance. It's still a land.

name: Celestial Convergence
text:
Celestial Convergence enters the battlefield with seven omen counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove an omen counter from Celestial Convergence. If there are no omen counters on Celestial Convergence, the player with the highest life total wins the game. If two or more players are tied for highest life total, the game is a draw.

name: Celestial Crusader
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Flying
Other white creatures get +1/+1.

name: Celestial Dawn
text:
Lands you control are Plains.
Nonland cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, spells you control, and nonland permanents you control are white.
You may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color. You may spend other mana only as though it were colorless mana.

name: Celestial Flare
text: Target player sacrifices an attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor:
"You were defeated the moment you declared your aggression."
—Gideon Jura
"You were defeated the moment you declared your aggression."—Gideon Jura

"You were defeated the moment you declared your aggression."
—Gideon Jura

name: Celestial Force
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"Wishing upon only one star seems like a failure of imagination."
—Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter

name: Celestial Gatekeeper
text:
Flying
When Celestial Gatekeeper dies, exile it, then return up to two target Bird and/or Cleric permanent cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.

name: Celestial Kirin
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, destroy all permanents with that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: All bow at its visitation—some in awe, some in honor, some in fear.

name: Celestial Mantle
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, double its controller's life total.

editions.flavor: Upon such armor, even a mountain would break.

name: Celestial Prism
text: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Celestial Purge
text: Exile target black or red permanent.

editions.flavor:
"This new chaos confounds us. We must fling it into our winds, our storms. These we can control."
—Bezzit Plar, Esper stormcaller

"We see clearly the error of your ways. It does not matter that you choose not to."
—Urien of the Lightwielders

"They say only the good die young. Obviously, you are one of the exceptions."
—Delrobah, cleric of Ivora Gate

"A world without evil? Boring. Give me vile fiends to smite and banish any day."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

"They say only the good die young. Obviously, you are one of the exceptions."
—Delrobah, cleric of Ivora Gate

name: Celestial Sword
text: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
"So great is its power, only the chosen can wield it and live."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

"So great is its power, only the chosen can wield it and live."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Celestine Reef
text:
Creatures without flying or islandwalk can't attack.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, until a player planeswalks, you can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.

name: Cellar Door
text: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the bottom card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If it's a creature card, you create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

editions.flavor: As if anyone needed another reason to avoid dark, dank cellars.

name: Cemetery Gate
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Protection from black

editions.flavor:
"It keeps some out, yes. It also keeps others in"
—Grandmother Sengir

"Just the place for a picnic."
—Murat, Death Speaker

name: Cemetery Puca
text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, Cemetery Puca becomes a copy of that creature and gains this ability.

editions.flavor:
"'Tis a strange creature indeed that chooses the vanquished over the victor."
—Awylla, elvish safewright

name: Cemetery Reaper
text:
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

editions.flavor: Every grave cradles a recruit.
Every grave cradles a recruit.
Every grave cradles a recruit.

name: Cemetery Recruitment
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If it's a Zombie card, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "There's a smoothness to my magic here that I don't find on any other plane."

name: Cenn's Enlistment
text:
Create two 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: The more the scarier.
The more the scarier.

name: Cenn's Heir
text: Whenever Cenn's Heir attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each other attacking Kithkin.

editions.flavor: His home clachan's familial spirit bolsters his own, but he will be ready to preside over the town as cenn only after he learns to project that strength to others.

name: Cenn's Tactician
text:
{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target Soldier creature.
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it can block an additional creature each combat.

editions.flavor: "A well-trained force brings peace... which brings more time for training!"
The choke point was the plan, but devoted camaraderie was always her strategy.

name: Censor
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Cycling {U} ({U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor:
"Why so many questions?"
—Temmet, vizier of Naktamun

name: Censorship
text:
When Censorship comes into play, choose a CENSORED word.
Whenever any CENSORED player says the chosen CENSORED word, Censorship deals 2 CENSORED damage to him or her.

editions.flavor: Editor's note: There were no suitable flavor text submissions for this card.

name: Centaur Archer
text: {T}: Centaur Archer deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

editions.flavor:
"Centaurs will kill our Aesthir if they can; they've always been enemies. Destroy the horse-people on sight."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

"Centaurs will kill our aesthir if they can; they've always been enemies. Destroy the horse-people on sight."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Centaur Battlemaster
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Centaur Battlemaster, put three +1/+1 counters on Centaur Battlemaster.

editions.flavor:
"A herd is only as strong as its weakest. Our weakest just killed his third minotaur raider—today."
—Braulios of Pheres Band

name: Centaur Chieftain
text:
Haste
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Centaur Chieftain has "When Centaur Chieftain enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn."

editions.flavor:
"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate

"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate

"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate

name: Centaur Garden
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Centaur Garden deals 1 damage to you.
Threshold — {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Centaur Garden: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Centaur Glade
text: {2}{G}{G}: Create a 3/3 green Centaur creature token.

editions.flavor: The Mirari called to the centaurs, and all who heard it were forever changed.

name: Centaur Healer
text: When Centaur Healer enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: Instructors at the Kasarna training grounds are capable healers in case their students fail to grasp the subtleties of combat.
Instructors at the Kasarna training grounds are capable healers in case their students fail to grasp the subtleties of combat.

name: Centaur Omenreader
text: As long as Centaur Omenreader is tapped, creature spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.

editions.flavor: The wisdom of the omenreaders is legendary. Creatures travel for miles through icy peril to seek their counsel.

name: Centaur Rootcaster
text: Whenever Centaur Rootcaster deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Centaur Safeguard
text:
({G/W} can be paid with either {G} or {W}.)
When Centaur Safeguard dies, you may gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: Swift, strong, and selfless, the centaurs are the shields of the Conclave.

name: Centaur's Herald
text: {2}{G}, Sacrifice Centaur's Herald: Create a 3/3 green Centaur creature token.

editions.flavor: The farther they go from Vitu-Ghazi, the less willing the crowd is to part for them.

name: Centaur Veteran
text:
Trample
{G}, Discard a card: Regenerate Centaur Veteran.

editions.flavor: He wears his scars like badges of honor, warning his foes that he's not easily defeated.

name: Centaur Vinecrasher
text:
Trample
Centaur Vinecrasher enters the battlefield with a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the number of land cards in all graveyards.
Whenever a land card is put into a graveyard from anywhere, you may pay {G}{G}. If you do, return Centaur Vinecrasher from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Center Soul
text:
Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

name: Cephalid Aristocrat
text: Whenever Cephalid Aristocrat becomes the target of a spell or ability, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: It's easy to tell the difference between the devious cephalids and the trustworthy ones. The trustworthy ones are dead.

name: Cephalid Broker
text: {T}: Target player draws two cards, then discards two cards.

editions.flavor: Cephalids value the free exchange of ideas—except for the "free" part.

name: Cephalid Coliseum
text:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. Cephalid Coliseum deals 1 damage to you.
Threshold — {U}, {T}, Sacrifice Cephalid Coliseum: Target player draws three cards, then discards three cards. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Cephalid Constable
text: Whenever Cephalid Constable deals combat damage to a player, return up to that many target permanents that player controls to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor: Cephalids don't police people. They police loyalties.
Cephalids don't police people. They police loyalties.

name: Cephalid Illusionist
text:
Whenever Cephalid Illusionist becomes the target of a spell or ability, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
{2}{U}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by target creature you control this turn.

name: Cephalid Inkshrouder
text: Discard a card: Cephalid Inkshrouder gains shroud until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn. (A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Cephalids shrink from the harsh glare of scrutiny.

name: Cephalid Looter
text: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.

editions.flavor: "Amazing, isn't it, what humans will throw away when they're drowning?"

name: Cephalid Pathmage
text:
Cephalid Pathmage can't be blocked.
{T}, Sacrifice Cephalid Pathmage: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: Pathmages can open doors that aren't even there.

name: Cephalid Retainer
text: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.

editions.flavor: Cephalids whisper flattery in your ear, put jewels in your hand, spin dreams in your head, and stick knives in your back.

name: Cephalid Sage
text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Cephalid Sage has "When Cephalid Sage enters the battlefield, draw three cards, then discard two cards."

name: Cephalid Scout
text:
Flying
{2}{U}, Sacrifice a land: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: The more they survey the dreadful dry expanses, the more the cephalids thirst to tame them.

name: Cephalid Shrine
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, counter that spell unless that player pays {X}, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as the spell.

name: Cephalid Snitch
text: Sacrifice Cephalid Snitch: Target creature loses protection from black until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The cautious are wary of their enemies. The wise are also wary of their friends.

name: Cephalid Vandal
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a shred counter on Cephalid Vandal. Then put the top card of your library into your graveyard for each shred counter on Cephalid Vandal.

name: Cerebral Eruption
text: Target opponent reveals the top card of his or her library. Cerebral Eruption deals damage equal to the revealed card's converted mana cost to that player and each creature he or she controls. If a land card is revealed this way, return Cerebral Eruption to its owner's hand.

name: Cerebral Vortex
text: Target player draws two cards, then Cerebral Vortex deals damage to that player equal to the number of cards he or she has drawn this turn.

editions.flavor: Izzet brains and Izzet boilers: contents under pressure.

name: Ceremonial Guard
text: When Ceremonial Guard attacks or blocks, destroy it at end of combat.

editions.flavor:
"These guards are the most disciplined military unit in the city. They couldn't fight their way out of a broom closet, but they've got discipline."
—Gerrard, to Sisay

name: Ceremonious Rejection
text: Counter target colorless spell.

editions.flavor: The judges at the Fair are held in such high esteem that a nod of recognition can inspire an inventor for a lifetime—and a wave of dismissal can end a career.

name: Cerodon Yearling
text: Vigilance, haste

editions.flavor: The unit of measurement used to chart a cerodon's growth is "persons consumed."
The unit of measurement used to chart a cerodon's growth is "persons consumed."

name: Certain Death
text: Destroy target creature. Its controller loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: Some spirits cling to one person, feasting on the growing fear until a final moment of all-consuming terror.

name: Cerulean Sphinx
text:
Flying
{U}: Cerulean Sphinx's owner shuffles it into his or her library.

editions.flavor:
"About the sphinx, I have mixed feelings. Their wisdom I crave, but their secrecy I can't tolerate."
—Szadek

name: Cerulean Wisps
text:
Target creature becomes blue until end of turn. Untap that creature.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"If you see ghostly lights by the river, eat three twigs of marshroot to ward off kelpies."
—Kithkin superstition

name: Cerulean Wyvern
text: Flying, protection from green

editions.flavor:
"Once, a Quirion asked why I was so cautious when the day was clear. I told him of the sky-blue hide of the cerluean wyvern, and he offered me double if I could conjure a strong tailwind!"
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

name: Cessation
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
When Cessation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Cessation to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"The face of Light will shine upon them, and they will know war no more."
—Song of All, canto 918

name: Ceta Disciple
text:
{R}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
{G}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "The sea holds all that you need. You simply must know how to ask for it."

name: Ceta Sanctuary
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a red or green permanent, draw a card, then discard a card. If you control a red permanent and a green permanent, instead draw two cards, then discard a card.

name: Cetavolver
text:
Kicker {1}{R} and/or {G} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} and/or {G} as you cast this spell.)
If Cetavolver was kicked with its {1}{R} kicker, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with first strike.
If Cetavolver was kicked with its {G} kicker, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with trample.

name: Chainbreaker
text:
Chainbreaker enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it.
{3}, {T}: Remove a -1/-1 counter from target creature.

editions.flavor: Scarecrows deemed too malevolent to roam free are shackled to boulders or dolmen stones. Their animosity usually outlives the chains.

name: Chained Throatseeker
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Chained Throatseeker can't attack unless defending player is poisoned.

name: Chained to the Rocks
text:
Enchant Mountain you control
When Chained to the Rocks enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until Chained to the Rocks leaves the battlefield. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)

name: Chainer, Dementia Master
text:
Nightmare creatures get +1/+1.
{B}{B}{B}, Pay 3 life: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is black and is a Nightmare in addition to its other creature types.
When Chainer, Dementia Master leaves the battlefield, exile all Nightmares.

name: Chainer's Edict
text:
Target player sacrifices a creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: The pits have their own form of mercy.
The pits have their own form of mercy.

name: Chainflinger
text:
{1}{R}, {T}: Chainflinger deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Threshold — {2}{R}, {T}: Chainflinger deals 2 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Chain Lightning
text: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Then that player or that creature's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

editions.set: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

name: Chain of Acid
text: Destroy target noncreature permanent. Then that permanent's controller may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

name: Chain of Plasma
text: Chain of Plasma deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Then that player or that creature's controller may discard a card. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

name: Chain of Silence
text: Prevent all damage target creature would deal this turn. That creature's controller may sacrifice a land. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

name: Chain of Smog
text: Target player discards two cards. That player may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

name: Chain of Vapor
text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Then that permanent's controller may sacrifice a land. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

name: Chain Reaction
text: Chain Reaction deals X damage to each creature, where X is the number of creatures on the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"We train for the improbable, like lightning striking the same place twice, or striking everywhere at once."
—Nundari, Sea Gate militia captain

"We train for the improbable, like lightning striking the same place twice, or striking everywhere at once."
—Nundari, Sea Gate militia captain
"We train for the improbable, like lightning striking the same place twice, or striking everywhere at once."—Nundari, Sea Gate militia captain

name: Chains of Mephistopheles
text: If a player would draw a card except the first one he or she draws in his or her draw step each turn, that player discards a card instead. If the player discards a card this way, he or she draws a card. If the player doesn't discard a card this way, he or she puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

name: Chain Stasis
text: You may tap or untap target creature. Then that creature's controller may pay {2}{U}. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

editions.flavor:
"Here we go again."
—Kakra, Sea Troll

name: Chalice of Death
text: {T}: Target player loses 5 life.

editions.flavor: The bitter taste of life's only certainty.

name: Chalice of Life
text: {T}: You gain 1 life. Then if you have at least 10 life more than your starting life total, transform Chalice of Life.

editions.flavor: The sweet taste of hope's promise.

name: Chalice of the Void
text:
Chalice of the Void enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
Whenever a player casts a spell with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Chalice of the Void, counter that spell.

name: Chambered Nautilus
text: Whenever Chambered Nautilus becomes blocked, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: What's merely a home for the nautilus can become exquisite jewelry in the hands of Saprazzan artisans.

name: Chamber of Manipulation
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}, Discard a card: Gain control of target creature until end of turn."

editions.flavor: Politics is just a subtle form of mind control—and cephalids are master politicians.

name: Chameleon Blur
text: Prevent all damage that creatures would deal to players this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Sometimes the best plan is neither fighting nor running."
—Freyalise

name: Chameleon Colossus
text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Protection from black
{2}{G}{G}: Chameleon Colossus gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is its power.

name: Chameleon Spirit
text:
As Chameleon Spirit enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Chameleon Spirit's power and toughness are each equal to the number of permanents of the chosen color your opponents control.

name: Champion Lancer
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.

editions.flavor: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.
The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.

name: Champion of Arashin
text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: "The blood of Dromoka and the blood of my veins are the same."

name: Champion of Lambholt
text:
Creatures with power less than Champion of Lambholt's power can't block creatures you control.
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of Lambholt.

name: Champion of Rhonas
text: You may exert Champion of Rhonas as it attacks. When you do, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. (An exerted creature won't untap during your next untap step.)

editions.flavor: The only way to finish the Trial of Strength is with a basilisk scale in hand.

name: Champion of Stray Souls
text:
{3}{B}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice X other creatures: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.
{5}{B}{B}: Put Champion of Stray Souls on top of your library from your graveyard.

name: Champion of the Parish
text: Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of the Parish.

editions.flavor: "I stand for every cobbler, tanner, and fool in this town—and they stand for me."
"I stand for every cobbler, tanner, and fool in this town—and they stand for me."

name: Champion's Drake
text:
Flying
Champion's Drake gets +3/+3 as long as you control a creature with three or more level counters on it.

editions.flavor:
"'Fraid of heights? Ride a horse. 'Fraid of missing out? Rein up a drake."
—Trinda, Hada spy patrol

name: Champion's Helm

editions.flavor: Adi Thandray designed this helm as a tribute to his mentor, the great Daljit Gavaskar.

name: Champion's Victory
text:
Cast Champion's Victory only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Return target attacking creature to its owner's hand.

name: Chance Encounter
text:
Whenever you win a coin flip, put a luck counter on Chance Encounter.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Chance Encounter has ten or more luck counters on it, you win the game.

editions.flavor: The more unlikely the victory, the more memorable the success.
